docs.snippet: Allegations that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's official smartphone app is shipping Indians' personal data to servers abroad have morphed into a political scandal in a country where privacy rules are weak and the data mining runs rampant.

headline.print_headline: Indian Scandal Brews Over Claim Modi's App Ships Data Abroad
headline.main: Indian Scandal Brews Over Claim Modi's App Ships Data Abroad

docs.snippet: The chief executive of data mining firm Cambridge Analytica told a reporter posing as a potential client that his company played a big role in getting Donald Trump elected, a British news program revealed Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Cambridge Analytica: We Designed Trump Campaign Strategy
headline.main: Cambridge Analytica: We Designed Trump Campaign Strategy

docs.snippet: Money spent on online advertising has risen rapidly, a leading forecaster said, despite talk about firms trimming digital ad budgets as they question the medium's effectiveness.

headline.print_headline: Advertisers Look to Online Ads for Brand Growth: Zenith
headline.main: Advertisers Look to Online Ads for Brand Growth: Zenith

docs.snippet: It is rare for an elected official in Japan to give birth, and voters often question her ability to juggle work and parenting.

headline.print_headline: In Japan, mothers in public office draw criticism
headline.main: In Japan, Voters Are Wary of Mothers in Public Office

docs.snippet: Norfolk Southern is moving derailed freight cars off the tracks after two trains collided in Georgetown, Kentucky, and sent four people to the hospital, the company said Monday in a statement.

headline.print_headline: Norfolk Southern Moving Derailed Freight Cars Off Tracks
headline.main: Norfolk Southern Moving Derailed Freight Cars Off Tracks

docs.snippet: A South African court jailed a white woman on Wednesday for yelling racist abuse at a black policeman, in a case that laid bare attitudes that endure more than two decades after the end of apartheid.

headline.print_headline: South African Woman Jailed in Landmark Ruling for Racist Rant
headline.main: South African Woman Jailed in Landmark Ruling for Racist Rant

docs.snippet: A roundup of some of the most popular but completely untrue headlines of the week. None of these stories is legit, even though they were shared widely on social media. The Associated Press checked these out; here are the real facts:

headline.print_headline: NOT REAL NEWS: A Look at What Didn't Happen This Week
headline.main: NOT REAL NEWS: A Look at What Didn't Happen This Week

docs.snippet: Meyers and other hosts had fun speculating about how actual fisticuffs between the tough-talking political septuagenarians would play out.

headline.print_headline: Seth Meyers on Trump vs. Biden: ‘Can You Imagine That Fight?’
headline.main: Seth Meyers on Trump vs. Biden: ‘Can You Imagine That Fight?’

docs.snippet: Britain called on Israel to improve the treatment of Palestinian children in military detention on Friday and said Israel should do more to safeguard vulnerable people in its care.

headline.print_headline: Britain Urges Israel to Improve Treatment of Detained Palestinian Children
headline.main: Britain Urges Israel to Improve Treatment of Detained Palestinian Children

docs.snippet: Shares of the file-sharing company jumped 36 percent on their first day of trading Friday. The debut is a promising sign for other start-ups.

headline.main: Dropbox Shares Leap in I.P.O., and Silicon Valley Smiles
